intro: Eriogonum subreniforme, commonly known as the broadleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its broad, often lobed leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It produces small, three-lobed seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum subreniforme is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
